In a message dated 4/7/2005 7:14:46 P.M. Central Daylight Time,  
jggilbert@... writes:

The  other menuki is a sho with a side-blown flute depicted behind it.   The
sho a mouth-blown reed instrument used in bugaku/gagaku (along with  that
type of flute, drums, etc.).  Masks are used in bugaku, some  with
exaggerated noses, but I don't know whether a tengu mask like that was  used.




Hi Jim, Ron,
I was thinking of " sho ", but on second thought I think that could be a  
feather fan.
I have seen woodblock prints with the tengu holding a feather fan.
I could be wrong ( most of the time it seems )
 
milt
